turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Hey!  I'm excited to see how this works.  How are you doing?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Good. How are you?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Great!  Have you ever heard of Save the Children - an international organization that helps kids in poor countries?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I think so, yes.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: I've just started learning about it, but I think it's incredible to be able to help kids who need it.  What country are you from?  What are your feelings about this topic?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: United States. I think it's a good cause but I would need more information about it before contributing a lot of money. I'd want to know what exactly they do and how they help the kids, how the money is distributed, how they select the children, etc.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: I totally get it.  It's non-government at least.  Last year they helped kids in Bangladesh who were refugees.  I think they see where there is a need and step in - so larger groups of children.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: What type of help do they offer? Shelter, food, medical supplies, education, relocation?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Shelter, food, hygiene, water, even training for how to take care of themselves.  It's the type of thing where you could give a little (or a lot) at one time, or sponsor a child, or do a one time give that supplies them with food or water or hygiene for a certain amount of time.  Lots of options...

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Wow, that's pretty comprehensive. What percentage of donations are overhead?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Fourteen percent is fundraising and management - so 86% goes to the kids.  That's pretty good!

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Yes, I agree.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Our family sponsors a child, and it gives us a good sense of "giving back".  It\'s why I asked where you are from.  I feel like in America we have so much!!!  It feels like we are helping more than ourselves and the people around us when we give internationally.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: That's great. I don't know if that's the same program but our church recently had a presentation on something similar.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: That's so great!  Churches are the best place to offer help - it

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Well, they help reach many people at the same time and I think it's pretty effective plus many people who attend are charitable.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Sorry I hit the return button instead of the ' button last time...  We attend church too, and it's another reason why we want to give - I mean it reminds us of how much we've been given.  Do you have any desire to give to this Save the Children organization? It could even just be the donation of this HIT...

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Not at this time because I don't have a job currently; that's the reason I didn't get involved in our church drive since I'm having a difficult time paying my own bills. As soon as I get back on my feet I'll look it up.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Sounds good.  Here's the link if you want more info later:  URL   I hope you find the perfect job soon!  I know being in your position can be stressful.  Glad you've got a community in your church that can hopefully give you encouragement too!

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Thank you so much, it's been very stressful. Thanks, I'll look them up. It's a pretty big church so we feel a bit lost, but thank you for your words!

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Maybe they have small groups you could join?  That helps at our church...

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: We just did. Thank you!!

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Hang in there!  Bye!
